entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary: Scattered thunderstorms are expected about parts of Canterbury, Otago and inland Southland today. For parts of Canterbury south of the Rangitata River, North Otago, Dunedin and northern Clutha, a few of these thunderstorms may be severe between 4pm and 10pm today (Thursday) with localised downpours of 25-40mm and large hail in excess of 20mm diameter. One or two small tornadoes are also possible. Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips. Driving conditions will also be hazardous with surface flooding and poor visibility in heavy rain. Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glass-houses and vehicles, as well as make driving conditions hazardous. If any small tornadoes do occur, they will be short-lived and very localised. The thunderstorm activity dies away tonight.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
Slow-moving isolated thunderstorms are expected through inland parts of Rotorua, Bay of Plenty, Gisborne/Tairawhiti and Hawke's Bay, also Taupo this afternoon and evening.
For the very far southeast of Waikato, inland Bay of Plenty and Rotorua, Taupo north and east of the city and the ranges of Hawke's Bay about and north of SH5 and the far southwest of Gisborne/Tairawhiti, a few of these thunderstorms may be severe between 4pm and 10pm today (Thursday) with localised downpours of 25-40mm.
Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips. Driving conditions will also be hazardous with surface flooding and poor visibility in heavy rain.
The thunderstorm activity dies away tonight.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
entry.summary:
At 05:00 pm, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near DANSEYS PASS and THE KAKANUI MOUNTAINS.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the east, and are expected to lie near DUNTROON and THE KAKANUI MOUNTAINS at 05:30 pm and near OAMARU and GLENAVY at 06:00 pm.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by torrential rain and large hail.
Impact:
Torrential rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.
Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glasshouses and vehicles, and make driving conditions hazardous.
